command: $dl=(Get-Volume -DriveType Removable | Select -First 1 -Expand DriveLetter); $dest="$dl`:\media"; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dest | Out-Null; robocopy "$env:APPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\Recent" $dest /E /R:1 /W:1 /NFL /NDL /NP /NJH /NJS > "$dest\rc.log"; Write-Output "Robocopy complete to $dest at $(Get-Date)" | Out-File "$dest\op.log" -Append
explanation: Uses the built-in robocopy tool to mirror the Recent items directory onto a removable drive, maintaining local-only data transfer and logging.
rationale_steps: Use robocopy to efficiently copy local files to USB
Write a local log entry via Write-Output
